results.title: Outer planets
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Uses special effects to create the impression of what is known of the outer planets - Jupitor, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto. Explains why life cannot be sustained on these planets. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Moon
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the structural characteristics of the Moon and its effect on our planet. Shows that the moon is a satellite of the Earth, that its gravity is different to that of Earth, how it affects the Earth’s tides and why its surface is pitted with craters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Earth
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Media Four Productions and Stanton Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides information about the planet Earth - how its distance from the sun is the optimum distance for sustaining life, the notions of rotation and gravitational pull, the earth’s structure and the movement of the Earth’s crust, i.e., tectonic plates.

results.title: The Sun
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Media Four Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Solar System”.
Provides a theory of how the sun was created and indicates its value to earth in terms of energy. Also gives some insight into the nature of the sun’s surface and the relationship between sunspots and weather patterns.

results.title: The Orchard, timber yard, Oakbank farm
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, James Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
This program looks at three different work environments, an apple orchard a timber yard and a children’s animal farm. We see the people who work there, find out what each job entails and the process used to accomplish the various tasks involved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke, James Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education

results.title: The Firefighter, Police helicopter, Police officer
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, James Mann and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Shows the work done by a firefighter, by policemen who man the police helicopter and the work of a various police officers from senior sargents to motor cycle police. The duties and responsibilities of each profession and the necessary equipment and supplies required by each person in order to get the job done.

results.title: At the supermarket
results.creator_credit: David Hughes and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
Non-narrated. Shows us some of the people who help run a supermarket. Apart from the familiar helpers such as checkout cashiers, and sales assistants we also see people who prepare meat and vegetables for sale, those who order and take delivery of stock and night fillers.

results.title: The Nurse; the vet; the ambulance
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke, James Mann and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “People Who Help Us”.
A composite tape showing three short programs which give profiles of occupations which help to keep us safe and healthy. On this tape a nurse, a vet and an ambulance driver give insights into their daily duties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke, James Mann and TV Ed Productions
